 043:                  Py_ssize_t[:] tmask,
 044:                  double[:,:,:] p, int ideg, double[:] wsp):
 045:     """
 046:     Compute transition probabilities exp(q*t) for a 'stack' of q
 047:     matrices, over all values of t from a 1-d array, where q is selected
 048:     from the stack by indices in qi. Uses pre-allocated arrays for
 049:     intermediate calculations and output, to minimize overhead of
 050:     repeated calls (e.g. for ML optimization or MCMC).
 051:     Args:
 052:         q (double[m,k,k]): stack of m square rate matrices of dimension k
 053:         t (double[n]): 1-d array of times (branch lengths) of length n
 054:         qi (int[n]): 1-d array indicating assigning q matrices to times
 055:         tmask (bint[n]): 1-d array indicating which t values to process
 056: 
 057:         p (double[n,k,k]): stack of n square p matrices holding results
 058:           of exponentiation, i.e., p[i] = exp(q[qi[i]]*t[i])
 059:         ideg (int): used in expokit Fortran code; a good default is 6
 060:         wsp (double[:]): expokit "workspace" array, must have
 061:           min. length = 4*k*k+ideg+1
 062:     """

 101:     """
 102:     Compute transition probabilities exp(q*t) for a 'stack' of q
 103:     matrices, over all values of t from a 1-d array, where q is selected
 104:     from the stack by indices in qi. Uses pre-allocated arrays for
 105:     intermediate calculations and output, to minimize overhead of
 106:     repeated calls (e.g. for ML optimization or MCMC).
 107:     Args:
 108:         q (double[m,k,k]): stack of m square rate matrices of dimension k
 109:         t (double[n]): 1-d array of times (branch lengths) of length n
 110:         qi (int[n]): 1-d array indicating assigning q matrices to times
 111:         p (double[n,k,k]): stack of n square p matrices holding results
 112:           of exponentiation, i.e., p[i] = exp(q[qi[i]]*t[i])
